repnme.cdata!: Yemen - Rainfed Agriculture and Livestock Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rain-fed Agriculture and Livestock
            Project for Yemen received a moderately satisfactory outcome
            with substantial risk to development outcome. Both the Bank
            and the Borrower received moderately satisfactory
            performance ratings for their part in the project. The IDA
            Development Credit Agreement (DCA) was restructured three
            times. The first restructuring introduced changes which: (a)
            reinstated the geographical coverage of the project to the
            original five governorates, following an agreement with the
            International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) to
            provide to bridge, inter alia, the remaining expenditures
            under Component 3 of the Project; and (b) modified the
            procurement thresholds. The second restructuring: (a)
            adjusted the scope of the project activities, and
            reallocated the proceeds across the modified activities
            (including the assignment of the unallocated fund in the IDA
            DCA; (b) modified the project implementation arrangements;
            (c) removed all procurement thresholds from the DCA and
            transferred these to the procurement plan; and (d) extended
            the project closing date by 27 months. The third
            restructuring of the IDA Credit aligned the PDO in the legal
            agreement with that in the PAD, and revised and enhanced the
            result framework and monitoring of the Project. Several
            lessons were learned from this project including the
            following: (1) in low-income fragile and conflict-affected
            states (FCS), for efficient project implementation under
            limited administrative capacity, develop a simple project
            design that promotes active participation of the
            beneficiaries, (2) create local-level coordination early
            because it may develop faster than that at the national
            level, (3) assess implementation capabilities carefully,
            including capabilities to use languages for procurement or
            to receive training, (4) assign the construction of large
            facilities to other entities when the implementing agency
            usually does not handle such large constructions, (5)
            improve evaluation designs so that PADs analysis could be
            replicated at completion.

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Rainfed Agriculture and Livestock
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Yemen Rainfed Agriculture and
            Livestock Project contribute to the higher development
            objectives of reducing poverty in rural areas and improving
            natural resources management. The restructuring includes:
            (i) the alignment of the Project Development Objectives, or
            PDO in the legal agreement with that in the Project
            Appraisal Document, or PAD and (ii) the modification and
            enhancement of selected indicators of the result framework
            and monitoring of the project. Country Director (CD)
            approval is sought since the proposed restructuring does not
            involve any modifications of the PDO as stated in the PAD
            nor a change in the safeguard category of the project, and
            therefore is being processed as a level two restructuring.

display_title.display_title:
Yemen - Rainfed Agriculture and
            Livestock Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
